text:
üö® For many jeepney drivers, today's big-time oil price hike translates to daily fuel expenses soaring to approximately P1,800 ‚Äî an amount that exceeds both the NCR minimum wage of P645 and the family living wage of P1,200.

This is further compounded by regressive taxes on fuel such as VAT and excise tax that disproportionately affect the poor while allowing billionaires to benefit from tax breaks. PISTON estimates that jeepney drivers have lost around a total of P6,400 of income due to these oil taxes since the beginning of the year. 

READ MORE ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/sODDtkU9rl
translated:
üö® For many jeepney drivers, today's big-time oil price hikes translates to daily fuel expenses soaring to approximately P1,800-an amount that exceeds both the NCR minimum wage of P645 and the family living wage of P1,200.

This is further compounded by regressive taxes on fuel such as VAT and excise tax that disproportionately affect the poor while allowing billionaires to benefit from tax breaks.Piston estimates that jeepney drivers have lost around a total of P6,400 of income due to these oil taxes since the beginning of the year.
